root.text: NETs physically trap and kill pathogens as well as activating and facilitating crosstalk between immune cells and complement.

source.quote: [ABSTRACT] NETs physically trap and kill pathogens as well as activating and facilitating crosstalk between immune cells and complement.

children.text: NETs physically trap and kill pathogens through the formation of NETs pores and the release of pore-forming proteins.

source.quote: [ABSTRACT] Exces- sive or inadequately resolved NETs are implicated in the underlying pathophysiology of sepsis and other inflamma- tory diseases, including amplification of the inflammatory response and inducing thrombotic complications.

children.text: NETs activate and facilitate crosstalk between immune cells and complement through the release of inflammatory mediators and the activation of complement cascade.

source.quote: [ABSTRACT] Here, we review the growing evidence implicating neutrophils and NETs as central players in the dysregulated host immune response.

children.text: NETs can be modulated to improve patient outcomes by targeting their physical trapping and killing properties, as well as their immunomodulatory and anti-inflammatory properties.

source.quote: [ABSTRACT] We discuss potential strategies for modifying NETs to improve patient outcomes and the need for careful patient selection.
